subject: Physical Fitness
title: What Is a Muscle
description: A quick win: understand What Is a Muscle.

hook.text: You have over 600 muscles. They make up roughly 40% of your body weight. But what actually are they?

buildup.text: A muscle is a bundle of fibers that contracts on command. Each fiber is thinner than a human hair.

discovery.text: Inside each fiber are myofibrils â€” tiny rods packed with proteins that slide past each other to shorten.

twist.text: Muscles can only pull, never push. Every movement requires opposing pairs working in balance.

climax.text: Your bicep bends the arm; your tricep straightens it. Without pairs, you'd be stuck in one position.

punchline.text: Muscles are protein ropes that can only pull. Everything else is teamwork.
